intro: Leucanthemum vulgare subsp. aligulatum, commonly known as the slender white daisy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features a basal rosette of narrow, silver-gray leaves and produces daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in well-drained soil in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed areas, and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators. The subspecies is distinguished by its slender stems and more elongated leaves compared to other members of the genus.
